name: plonked
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
past simple and past participle of
plonk
plonk verb
(PUT DOWN)
[ I or T, usually + adv/prep ] mainly UK (US usually plunk) to put something down heavily and without taking care: Just plonk the shopping (down) on the table, and come and have a cup of tea. Come in and plonk yourselves (down) (= sit down) anywhere you like.

See more results »
plonk verb
(INSTRUMENT)
[ I usually + adv/prep ] ( also plunk) to play a musical instrument, usually not very well but often loudly: I really enjoy plonking away on the piano.
